body.p:
To His Excellency, -- James F Robinson
Governor of :Kentucky

respectfully represents that he is the Driver or Agent for Your Petitioner in the Sale of "Roback's Bitters," and was arrested while so employed in the C. W. Roback and fined $50 and costs. He showed a City License to C W Roback to peddle said Bitters in said city on which was an endorsement that Petitioner was the Agent of said Roback. The Magistrate however decided that no one but Mr Roback himself could drive the waggon and furnish said Bitters in said City, and differed with the in the Construction of the City ordinance. Petitioner sends herewith the statements of the Mayor, Magistrate and Hon City of CovingtonCity Mayor the acting County Attorney, who join in the prayer of this Petitioner to have said fine cancelled and your Petitioner pardoned. was tried before J F FiskYour Petitioner J. P. B Eggleston and it is admitted that if said Magistrate decided the law correctly, that the offence was caused by the mistaken adviceK C
of the Mayor who issued the License. The establishment of is in C. W. Roback, and Petitioner acted as his driver in bringing over his Bitters to various persons in the , and believed that under the License of Mr Roback which Petitioner carried with him, and on which was endorsed that he was the Agent of Mr Roback, that he was legally authorized to do so under the instructions of the Mayor. Cincinnati, OhioCity of Covington
Your Petitioner respectfully prays that said penalty or fine be cancelled by the exercise of the Executive Clemency. And your Petitioner will ever pray --

I was acting for the County Atty in prosecuting the defendant, The facts are correctly set forth in the above. I am of the opinion that petitioners employer was misled by the Mayor -- that had he not been informed that his driver could peddle under his employer's License & that the offense would not have been committed hence I ask that the fine be remitted.

Will Shmoddle Pettn fine remitted
J F Robinson
send John P.l Harrison
Covington
Kenton J P Ct
$50 } Peddling
Issd Aug 15 1863
